_PPTSmWYjNMFloOuVCpmtQ.text: Ok talking about quick blazing pizza!!! This is the spot great pizza with all the toppings. You also have some other things to choose from but MAN this pizza is AMAZING!!! Definitely need to check it out!

a33pYzi_6WgQregrOqDW1Q.text: Love blaze to death but there is nothing blaze about it. These workers are beyond slow. The rating is purely on the service not the pizza. Dedicate at least half an hour to get your pizza.....this is not a "blazing fast place"!

Jx8Ftlm0lRqS0u4FrV39-g.text: Used to be amazing but it seems they have hired a bunch of new kids (which is great!) & not trained them properly (not so great). There is confusion with regard to matching names & numbers which affects whether you get the right pizza. The pizzas are not consistent anymore, whether you get one that actually looks appetizing or doesn't have a fistful of garlic on it depends on who makes your pizza. Please train your employees better.

b4WqLmCAlbTl_tW0WK-yxQ.text: 1st timer at this place. The staff was friendly asking if we needed help with figuring out how they worked or any questions.  Got a create your own pizza and went down the line choosing toppings.  Also got garlic knots for myself and my daughter.  After creating they cook it in the wood fired oven.  Pizza was delicious.. and fairly quick which is great at lunch.  My favorite thing was they had several flavored waters and lemonades with the drinks.  I got a blood orange lemonade which was wonderful!! I loved that they had options besides soda or water and especially since I don't like a lot of caffeine the lemonade made a very flavorful choice.  The only negative I have (and it's not the restaurants fault) is the is very very little parking in the strip mall.

webS6FU8MUHjpEpPI0qyOg.text: If you are looking for a thin crust pizza that is crispy and cooked in a fire oven. Look no further. I have eaten a lot of pizza over the years and have grown tired of the normal chain places. I dont care for the thick crust and I like the ability to walk in and make it just like I want it when it comes to veggies, sauce, cheese etc. They also have a decent variety of drinks and offer salad selections. Beware you may not be able to finish the individual pizza it is very filling. There usually is a line when you go but it is worth the wait.

KE5q3YXWLLes3a9MApAt8Q.text: If you enjoy eating ashes, come get a pizza here. I realized they just opened, but I paid $10 for a pizza that I couldn't even eat. The toppings looked picked over and not fresh. The mushrooms were turning pink. The staff are rude and rushy. But the biggest thing was that the oven was not clean and they sat my pizza in a pile of ashes.

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gross burnt pizza from the uncleaned oven. Extremely nasty.

2qGev-OME4r4ZQE50L8Fvg.text: This is by far the worst location, I have visited, the staff seem to oblivious to what's going on. I can in to pick up a to go order at 7pm. I'm still here waiting for q pizza that literally take 10 minutes to create and bake. If I could give it zero stars, I would! I have watch at least 30 people come in and get there pizza's  and yet I am still waiting at 7:35pm.

y38FcLBRKMmRKy0SbxOstA.text: I was so excited Blaze came to University City, and even more excited I was able to get a better look at the business with Yelp. I usually get a basic pepperoni pizza with red sauce , mozzarella and parmesan cheese , which is so good I don't even try anything else, yet Blaze has so much more to offer. Know that the dough is made fresh daily. The meat toppings are nitrate free, and free of other additives and preservatives. Blaze is a place where there is something for everyone , especially the health conscious . This location is conveniently located in the boardwalk area of University City and is definitely a place you should visit.

YJcM2_ysXlaruSbl9UaE9A.text: I haven't been to many of these fast casual build your own pizza places yet but I really like Blaze.  They use top notch ingredients and fresh dough they make in house every day.  I love the concept of being able to put whatever I want on a pizza because I can never decide in the first place.  It also has a great selection of fresh salads and sides including great chocolate cookies you can add on for dessert.  I also love the fact they have Mexican Coke available in the bottle.  This alone is usually a mark of a place that knows what they are doing and really care about the small things.  Quality all around here and I must say I really like the location as it is tucked away but very open with adequate outdoor seating when the weather permits.  My one regret is that I did not try the unique lemonade combinations they had on tap.  Will return!

v7Oi0lJOCopGJsgDDwCetg.text: Hands down 5 stars for the name! It was funny telling the guy starting my order that my name was Blaze... he took a bit of a double take.  It's worth noting that everyone here seemed very happy and willing to help- obviously this team was trained very well!  This place is cool, definitely a unique concept. It's similar to a subway, but with pizza. You choose your crust (regular, thick, or gluten free) and then you either choose one of their recipes or you choose your own toppings. You can get unlimited toppings on your personal pizza and it only costs about 8 dollars. Once your done selecting toppings, they "fast fire" the pizza in the oven for 3 minutes, very quick... while I was paying, my order was already in the oven, and after I filled my drink it was done. They also have salads and desserts, I didn't try these, but they looked very good.   Was the pizza the best I've ever had? No... but it certainly wasn't bad. I'd like to try the thicker crust next time. The thin crust wasn't crispy like you'd usually expect... but rather kind of mushy.  Still good, just not for everybody. The topping selection was great (so much to choose from), but the taste of those toppings wasn't really anything to rave about. Again, not bad at all, just not the best.   They have a wide variety of artisan type drinks, lemonades, sodas, etc. I liked their tea and I also tried one of their fruit beverages... both very good.   Overall, I would certainly recommend giving this place a try... the pizza was good... and you might even love this places unique culinary style. If not, you'll certainly love the concept, atmosphere, and friendly staff.

EKey5anxECDx4isw7t3eTw.text: So good!! We got build your own. The pesto sauce was amazing. Service was very fast and they where all very nice. Can't go wrong here. Can't wait to come back and try a new combination.

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yummy!! Obsessed

42XY8QhIcBIWYcgAUHpjxQ.text: I enjoyed the made to order build your own pizza. Lots of variety and healthy options! Atmosphere is very retro and has great energy. The staff was very friendly and attentive! I will be returning for another experience...

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. First Saturday after opening very busy!
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. My Build my Own Pizza!
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Some of the drink options. The Bloody Orange Lemonade was my favorite!!!

27PE899KbkqAwuzOiTGJfg.text: First time going, have always heard good things about it. It was a little tough to understand the first employee but eventually we worked thru it. Think Chipotle style. After we picked our ingredients and paid, our name was called within 5 minutes. Pizza was delicious, great size for me. She had some left over but ate the rest later on. Would definitely go again!

RK59jiiBf-fkO5oCRl54gA.text: Can't complain. This is like a subway for pizza. The crust was crispy because it's cooked in a nice pizza oven until perfection. It doesn't take long either. They have a ton of toppings too! I got chicken, spinach, pesto, ricotta, bell peppers, etc. then they have drizzles to put on your pizza at the end. It's a quick lunch stop with a very casual atmosphere!  Eat on!

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. My pizza

TXghTxAGOp0_hdTL7hwbvA.text: This pizza joint is the Joint....you can get all the toppings you want no limit love love love!!! You can choose from the thin which is original or high rise which is the thicker one both are good....I like the thin the best but I don't like a lot of bread.

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blaze is the spot great all around no limit on how many toppings
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blaze pizza is the best....any topping no limit....great crust...this is the new spot

hmvxenbucs-eM2n3SXE6Nw.text: I Enjoy this business model! Make your own pizza.  the service is quick..  food is great. nice place to go with friends!

wYWZSRVsH2uHACHQciEndQ.text: Great taste and fantastic price and selection. Tony runs this place like a real pro and corporate suits should take notice

Jv6DU5Taj2IPQOzXrTVwwQ.text: Pretty great place. Good pizza and crunchy crust. I didn't like the Caesar salad. It was bland. Other than that pretty good place.

AF9phfT-ckjFOm92odMDhg.text: Noisiest restaurant without TV's that I have ever been in. Had to shout to get my order heard. But that was ok. The pie however was not.  While I like super thin crusts I prefer they actually have taste. I ordered simple pepperoni and cheese and frankly it had little flavor. I could not even taste the pepperoni.  Very bland. Had the arugula with fruit side salad and it was pretty good.  First time I ever wanted to salt a pizza in my life. Alas, I could find no salt anywhere. Sorry Blaze @University, I was hopeful.

qspOITOYx3UEuGrlLjXtUA.text: OMG so good!! I went one in Bakersfield and thought it was amazing so I couldn't wait to try it again. I was NOT disappointed!! I love that they make it in front of me and I can ask them to do a little bit or more. I also love the spicy red sauce! Wish we had one near me in Colorado!

dTxZcUOM4uaQKx9gaHy9ew.text: Used the app to order my pizza which was a breeze. As a plant-based dietician it was great they offered vegan cheese. Went to the establishment to pick up my pie and it was pleasantly waiting for me. #winning

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. The arugula takeover pizza...

0I9AT-l0ZFjjAjrWFcYq-Q.text: So the concept, pizzas, service, prices (excluding the side salad pricing which is stupid) are all 5-star worthy. Chipotle model for pizza. Fabulous ingredients. It's the best of the fast casual concept. BUT JESUS please turn the music down. It's so loud people are literally shouting to talk. Funny because I've literally heard the owner (cool guy) yelling to (not at) another complaining customer that 'it's corporate policy to have it at this level'. Even outside. Please guys, you're killing it, but turn down the effing tunes.   Update. They've lowered the music. All is good.

Y-qADaXIGsP0Llgjhecrng.text: We got the meat eater and build your own pizza, which was basically the white top with a few extra ingredients. The whole process is extremely quick and it doesn't take long for the pizzas to cook. We really enjoyed the food!

48YK2Ssz8LlAZnZvvmu-zg.text: I've been here many times. Food is good, pricing is reasonable, customer service has been decent.  But tonight I came at 9:25 pm (you're open until 10:00 pm). I wanted to sit down and grab a quick dinner. Outdoor sign was turned off and all the chairs were up on the tables. It's almost like you don't want people coming in to eat your food after 9.  Message received, loud and clear. I went to 5 Guys, who incidentally, closes at the same time, and their chairs were on the floor.

b6CrB9l_wsNiaUTwUJoefA.text: Pizza was okay. The crust was overly baked which made it hard asf. Only turn off for me was how dirty the place was...one of the workers had her whole hair outside of her hat. And she was really pissed when I tried to order..Dont know how low IQ she is...but there is 99% chance that her huge weave/hair did fallout into the food at some point. Not coming back forsure. People need to understand the importance of sanitation. Its 2019 already. Stop living like you in a damn cave.

AtiCmllTi5H4ZMNtub95Jw.text: I am in love with this place and planning on going back asap.  It's located in the new strip mall across from boardwalk billys.  You can order a pre-made option like meat lovers or BBQ chicken or you can build your own.  At the counter it's like a sandwich shop, you go down the line and tell them what toppings you want. From sauce to cheese to meats to veggies, and there is no up charge,  you can get as many toppings as you want.  They throw in the fire oven and a few minutes later it's ready. The crust is so crisp from the oven my it's delicious. It's  $8.50 for a pizza with unlimited toppings. Also, they get busy during lunch, may want to go a little early!

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bbq chicken pizza
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Toppings

UNVXssKK7xCFLF6-tvTexA.text: Finally got a chance to try! Blaze might not be the best pizza I've ever had, but it was definitely good, even without considering how cheap it is. For (I think) $8.50, you can get a personal pizza with unlimited toppings OR half a custom pizza and garlic knots. The staff was polite, my food came fast (despite being 12:30), and it was somewhat quiet while still crowded. Good, cheap, fast. What more do you need?

y8YyZcq2ynC9z57XHjOsUQ.text: Service was really fast and the pizza was delicious. The water cups are extremely small so they definitely need to go up a few sizes. The weather was great so u could without a doubt sit outside. Blaze gets 5 stars!

QrYuTZ0045Bm0aafXKhkGQ.text: Very friendly staff and speedy service. Could use some improvement in keeping a tidier dining area.

gE6yRh5MtlUI_zTEMt-Y7A.text: The reason I'm giving this place 2 stars and not one is because the pizza here is really good and the ingredients are fresh. However, when we were on line watching the staff make our pizzas, one of their workers did NOT pull their long hair back.. and so her braids were dragging all over the pizzas (yes it was touching the food she was preparing). We talked to the manager immediately, to which he had her pull her hair back and work on other tasks. They offered to remake our pizzas so that was good, but HOW in the world did they not notice this?!? And how long was her hair touching people's food?? No idea, but that's a big health code violation. Gross. UPDATE*** The owner reached out to me and seemed very concerned with my issue. This doesn't seem like a common occurrence and the company, from what I can tell, strives to make sure everything is up to code. I am very pleased with the way this was resolved and I can definitely tell they care about their customers. I Will be going back!!

eyg8s3Ny9gdJoppBx1dgIQ.text: Order 9:30 via DoorDash. Pizza was so bored on bottom. Hit or miss... good great food but crew customer service is hit or miss.

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

gmj6Imf2RRkHpxMf8uZqVA.text: Perfect portion but limited options. The dough is not crisp and the sauce was a tad bit bland. It was just ok pizza. It wouldn't be my 1st choice or go-to but its a great option to hang with friends or let the kidz be creative.

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

8nY1vGHrk0d6IloxzBKFRw.text: This place is kind of like a Subway for pizza as far as the set up. You tell them what you want on your pizza and they make it as you tell them. They then put your personal pizza in the oven to cook. Surprisingly the pizza was really good! Fresh ingredients with good tasting sauce. The customer service was really good too. Will definitely be returning.

99N6kBFZvBe0lX2vi6r3MA.text: This place is so delicious. You can make any pizza you want and the staff is always nice. I would say the only downside is that they don't sweep their ovens very well so my crust gets burnt sometimes but this is a great place to go for lunch with a date. Not as much of a family place because you have to pay for everyone's separate pizza instead of sharing one.

m5LmG6iPWMCDMB0rn_3pcA.text: Lovely place nice ambience n yummy pizza...lots of option...great choices...I love thin crust pizzas so it was really good for me.

2PqixtAnUXnSS0l2ykyuAg.text: Made a pickup order for 3 pizzas.  Order is typed out on each pizza and it's correct.  Open pizza and 2 of the 3 are completely wrong. Not even close.  Now I'm eating a bagel.

9PDgvKO4Q4g9uABps2Ti6w.text: I've been waiting to review this one because I simply wanted to try as many things as possible before doing so. The first pizza I had at Blaze was "Build Your Own", and I went crazy. Red sauce, two different types of mozzarella, turkey meatballs, chicken, olives, banana peppers....I can keep going but I can't remember it all lol! This delicious concoction went into a wood fired oven and was topped off with a pesto drizzle at the end! Wow, It was great!   I told myself that if I can literally throw the kitchen sink of ingredients they have to offer on a pizza and it taste as good as it did, then their signature specialties must be great too. After numerous visits, I've tried their "Art Lover", the "White Top", the "Veg Out", and the "Green Stripe". All of these variations have different flavor profiles, and are very unique. I can say I thoroughly enjoyed each of the ones I tried. Full of flavor, great textures, and just the right temperature when it comes out the oven.   Blaze Pizza uses fresh ingredients, and everything is made to order. The layout is pretty much like the "Subway" or "Pita Pit" of pizzas, where all of the toppings are laid out in front of you to choose from, and a person behind the counter builds the pizza. When you order the pizza for take out, they wait to throw it in the wood fire oven until you get there so that way you can add ingredients to your pizza and make sure it's made exactly to your liking. I also love their finishing touches. You can get drizzles like BBQ sauce, Balsamic Vinaigrette, and Pesto on top of your pizza once it comes out the oven.   The pies are individual, but you can surely share one with someone and still be full depending on what you get on top of the pizza.  Prices are very reasonable too! You can get a pie and a fountain drink for under $10!   There really isn't anything bad I can say about this place. It's really unique, affordable, convenient, and can function as a lunch or dinner option.   I recommend Blaze with utmost confidence!

_LqvACukXjL3nVfwISCdmQ.text: Great pizza! Got the thick crust it is an extra $2 but worth it! Long wait at lunch so plan ahead

dXUqS2z2f2F04hQQhOG67A.text: Love the fact that I can build my own pizza for a reasonable price and get fairly pleasant service

wqxZ9CuV8jxYaXCkQJn5XQ.text: This place is so unique! I love pizza and I love that it gives me options in real time! The seating tends to be a bit limited at times...but I've always managed to enjoy the food whilst sitting.

IOxNUxUGFYUzSak1iGBaag.text: If Blaze was the last meal I could ever have that would be enough! I came on opening day and they were giving out free build your own pizzas all day AND WE EVEN GOT A COUPON FOR A FREE BOGO PIZZA!   The staff members were super friendly and even bought out water cups to guests standing in line. They had conversations with what seemed like every person in line and made me feel so welcome!   The pizza was amazing (per usual) but their blood orange lemonade taste like it came straight out of heaven!!! I can't wait to go back to this location since it's closer to where I live!   P.S.-The BBQ drizzle at the end is life changing!!

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. can barely eat this lol.
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

_3l739T26H5TFvnyt2eEWg.text: Went to the Elite Event. Had a blast love meeting other Yelpers.   FOOD: I had the BYOP (Build Your Own Pizza). Blaze Pizza will remind you of Subway but it's pizza. You are able to pick you own toppings or one of the specialty pizza. All pizzas are cooked with order. I also had the Kale salad, it was a little to vinegary for me. The cookies was good (I had the chocolate chip). They have fresh lemonade that is made daily, the Mango flavor is VERY LIGHT, the Lemonade flavor is VERY tart. The best flavor is the bloody orange (the name is something like that) and another good one is the Strawberry (tho' it was a very lite flavor it was not too sweet and was not watered down like the Mango flavor)  INSIDE: Nice set up, they had UNCC colors on the wall. They have high table and regular tables and outdoor seating. Tho' if the place is packed it could be a bit loud. The staff was super nice and the manager and some of the owners were nice also. Once I told the young lady that took my order,that I have never been to Blaze pizza before she explained how it work.  Location: There is a free parking in a lot, you can walk from Blaze to Boardwalk(which is a good). The location is perfect and right by other shops.   Price: great price around $6.00 and up

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kale salad
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. My Build your own pizza

RDcGqLXxTKX9mff82r7Utg.text: Of all the chain pizzerias I have to go with Blaze! Although Uncle Maddio's is one of our favorites, Blaze beats them out with a few extras!   For starters their crust is delicious and their sauce options are excellent, especially the garlic pesto! They have a wide variety of cheeses and protein toppings and don't forget to add some sea salt to your pizza, it's an perfect finishing touch.   The service is fast and friendly and they offer military discounts. They also have a nice outdoor seating area and parking is decent. It's also a great area to walk after you eat with some nice dessert options nearby.   Blaze is some good pizza!

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pesto with Italian Sausage, Fresh Mozzarella &amp; Fresh Basil
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pesto with Italian Sausage &amp; Tomatoes

hL1lIRVCG7Rqu0B7uoKr3A.text: I was in the area for a hair appointment and decided to try blaze pizza. The young people taking my order were nice and friendly . The size of pizza you get for 5.25 was a good deal as well. I just got a plain pie with a little pesto. It was pretty good, what I expect to taste when I get pizza. Next time I'll ask for it to stay in the oven a little longer. I did have a Yelp coupon upon checking in and I felt like the lady ringing me up was a little rude when she told me they do not honor them but she will only this time. It was just a free fountain drink. I was actually ok with them not honoring it but she didn't give me a chance to say anything. After cashing out she just walked away and a young man took over and he goes "didn't you get a drink?" And hands me a cup. I ended up getting water anyway lol. That was that . I'll get it again if I'm in the area but there won't be any special trips for it .

QwOyahYWtrDQd1-JcPXw6w.text: Good place for pizza,, you can actually order "make your own" and literally put everything on it. Place is clean and staff friendly!  They also have gluten free!

cruCC7yJb3Jc9z-09bngYg.text: Workers were in a bad mood and all complained about having to be there. Every single one of them. I was even trying to brush it off and I said "rough day?" To one of the employees and he looked at me and said "I'm just about to go get high." It was very unprofessional. They wouldn't take my yelp coupon for a free drink. They complained about splitting my order between me and a friend and rolled their eyes then proceeded to charge me for a drink come to find out their drink machine was down and the rest of the people I was with got their drink free but I didn't. Over all the food was good but the staff but all 3 of us in a bad mood and kinda killed the happiness we had about our day. And my coupon is gone and I cannot try to use it at a different blaze pizza.

6qLMw27gCo9SAUQfQ-848g.text: Came here for good ol pi day. It was the perfect time to try this place out because everyone raves about it and the pizzas were only $3.14. I ordered the green stripe pizza but no chicken and added white sauce as the base. Once again a made to order place so I walked in happy and the pizza was good minus the sea salt. I think next time I'll order the high rise dough cause the regular dough was not enough but def worth the trip and veryyyyy good pizza!

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

u1MMQcfRHjjJxy09DPElDg.text: I love Blaze Pizza! I always go to the one in University Area and my pizza is always perfect. I've even been offered complimentary topping a few times. Delano has great customer service skills and is very funny and social. Tony also makes me laugh and he recommended the brownies to me one time and really talked thrm up, with good reason. They are so moist and delicious; I get one extra now. Great food and great staff. I have nothing bad to say.

kEMttoZFSoMGJiCg4qi7sA.text: Those garlic knots are really really good. Unfortunately I ordered delivery through postmates today and they arrived black and burnt. No exaggeration. Will never order online again. And it will be a long time if ever if I go back. Whoever thought those burnt items were OK to send out to a customer should get fired.

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. How my food arrived from Postmates

lMXVIM2hcenTVMrAcKjHhg.text: Blaze is really some great fast casual pizza. Heck, I'd say it's great pizza period. So Blaze works like any other fast casual joint, you line up and order your food. They have multiple options for your pizza or salad. The food comes out quickly, you pick it up and take your seat. You have options there too of course; tea, water, beer, wine or soda. Make sure you try the blood orange lemonade. Man is it good!

m2hYEdSSUB18GEQXsikC6Q.text: Very slow service! It appears to be no order and poor leadership that causes long lines and poor production. There are a lot of young kids working there which is a good thing however many of them don't have good work ethics and or professionalism and that is causing poor customer service. They need a good manager to fix this location because it is the absolute worst BLAZE location that I've ever been to. They car NOTHING about the food they serve and that's evident with this pizza I received today. It tasted just as horrible as it looks. I would've asked for it to be made over but after looking at everyone else's pizza there was no hope for a better outcome. This was a HORRIBLE dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

lQ_Nfj7bv77eXGHeQw5H-g.text: The food is decent but the management is terrible and ran by horrible people. The managers, Eddy and Tiffany specifically, have allowed an environment of hostility and mistreatment of their employees. The store has terrible turnover, firing employees at an unprecedented rate, and are completely okay with bigotry such as homophobia and transphobia. Slurs and hateful rhetoric is ok, as these employees get nothing but a slap on the wrist, but victims get terminated because of "minor infractions". Neither of these people should be running a business, and this location should be investigated for violating civil rights.

rUtKmqRIjwcHBHiUjjHLLw.text: Go to pizza place, right next to UNCC, the boardwalk and other stores. Great prices, under 10$ always, and good service. The pizza is made in a brick oven and you can watch them do it, so you aren't just sitting there bored. Reason I gave it 4 stars and not 5 is because fired pizza isn't my favorite because on the bottom of the pizzas there's ashes lol. Other than that this is my favorite pizza place to go to!!

5wRzyDWAzACzcnBfOQyE8g.text: I was super impressed!! My Pizza was great! We went on a Wednesday so there was no line or crowd. The pizza was ready fairly quickly. I will definitely be back soon. Didn't get any pictures (sorry) but I will next time. It's a yes from me! More to come.

QZ4iqciVApQAvlhjlHVNBw.text: I visited last night for a to go order expecting it to be good like the other Blaze Pizza. To my disappointment both the pizzas I got was burnt.   Kyle & his team were amazing and was quick to replace the pizza. I recommend this place and will be a regular.

yj_tnZn9UgjkvQIZ5cb0-g.text: I first came here for a Yelp event. The people who work here are very nice, I've been back twice since. I like the fact that they have so many options for toppings. I especially like the goat cheese. I also like that they have different meat options as well...turkey meatballs! Everything is so fresh and just Yummy!  Oh! The blood orange lemonade...GET IT!

B9YkX4T0U0xOWRu5X7JyOQ.text: Blaze pizza is always really good.  I have been to the one on south end and really liked it so when it came to the University area, I was really excited. Inside is really nice. Keep in mind, during the weekdays at night it can get really busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

6zACnm92l2BLkdJavKSiMQ.text: I love the idea of this quickly cooked pizza  and build your own options . I've been here twice , first time pizza came out perfect , second time the bottom was so badly burned it was practically inedible .  Not sure if the oven is dirty or the cook just let it bake too long , but it was pretty upsetting to get home  , prop my feet up and get ready to dive into my dinner  and see the bottom of my pizza was coal black   . The brownies are really good and I love to get them warmed . Hopefully the 3rd time will be the charm and it will be delicious again .

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

-q2DQpenItUJ55Kp1d3NcQ.text: So this is the Chipotle of Pizza and I love it! Lots of fresh ingredients and sauces. Perfect lunch spot with quick service! Pick you crust, cheese,  sauce and unlimited toppings for 1 low price, who can beat that. Then they put it in a wood fired grill, I mean I really love this place and beverages are delicious also! I just might go get some today.

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

H7ROaAqD8kCcDeRP5rXylA.text: Always do build your own pizza. Yummy yummy yummy. Salad are fresh and flavorful.  Even when the line is to the door it doesnt take long.

-xikx9Il4y0t8yhDCEaWZA.text: Open late enough to grab food before hitting the sack.   Location is convenient and the folks are friendly.  Ordered a Take Two for the first time and its tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Boom.  Friday night moves to Blaze Pizza.

D59pptvubAHX5nCmxt5yag.text: I went back a few weeks ago, and it was much better. The pizza was cooked correctly, it had a great flavor, and I enjoyed it. With that said, I'm not impressed anymore. We ended up waiting almost five minutes before someone helped us (there was no one in front of us, the staff just kept preparing call-in orders and completely ignoring us), the ingredients taste fresh and good, but while there seems to be a lot of options, the options themselves seem rather limited, and I just am not a fan of the place anymore.  If someone asked me to meet them there, I'm not saying I would not go, but I'd probably suggest we meet up at Cava or Pei Wei instead. I'm sorry, I'm just not a big fan of a chain that seems more about a gimmick than about quality and customer service.

IY6OdLAIDLlrNzpmAjkLNw.text: So yum..!!! Just irresistible and that too in a budget  Their crust is so gooood. I chose vegetarian ingredients in my pizza and it was just unbelievable! Do try their Dough Knots it's worth

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

u6xD1wHnUVvPaQiETJFJPQ.text: The pizzas here are fabulous! The toppings are premium and you can add all that your heart desires at no additional cost!   Normally that is all it takes to give a five star review, but the service from the manager, Tony,  outshined EVEN the pizza.   We had a delivery order from Postmates that was missing a topping, Kalamata Olives, though Tony had written it down for the folks making our pizza, they still forgot them. He apologized and offered us a pizza replacement for the next day. When we came in he went above and beyond what he originally promised and was so kind. Also one couldn't help but notice Tony was on the register, he was getting pizzas from the oven, he was bussing tables, and somehow found time to check on us to make sure our pizzas were perfect this time- all with a smile. We were floored and quite thankful to get to come in even though it was originally for a mistake.  We left full and happy! We will definitely be back.

MsU4g2zvT5hlK8GJ2bQElg.text: Every time I come here everyone is super friendly and I've never waited to log for my pie.  Defiant place to come when you got the munchies, you get exactly what you want! Plus they have beer

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Regular sauce, light mozzarella, X gorgonzola, Mushroom, roasted garlic, roasted Brussels, salt, oregano, buffalo and BBQ drizzling (:

Z8kqxjlHyU6FXjc4Ka5s0A.text: The food is great, but every time I come in here there is an issue with me ordering a gluten free pizza with a glove change. They either end up not changing gloves or have an issue with the crust or run out of dough. Love the food once they get it correct, though.

2bWJMmK1C1BPpQflCm287A.text: I love their idea. You can do half, you can do customize the pizza, you can get any kind of pizza you want. It is so good. Never disappointed. Will make many more visits before I leave Charlotte to NJ. The only downside is they burn the pizza most of the times. :(  Please do a careful quality check on that pizza. Most of the guys who do pizza , do not look into it carefully, they get chatty with each other and do a time pass in cellphone.  I do agree with some reviews with burnt pizzas.

gwTdfKrqWGXSShl9vT9QtQ.text: Food is still good. Tried the new garlic knots. Not as big in the picture. Most crusty cheese than bread. Good in taste. Had them for free on the mobile app but still was charged for them anyway. Should see a refund soon on my card.

kl7eRPda5iCxR5GasBEUjw.text: I guess you could say my first experience with Blaze was brief... which would make since given their namesake (Fast-Fire'd Pizza). The pies themselves we're great given their price-point, but the service was a bit lacking.  After giving their neighbor, City BBQ, a try a couple of days ago, the large crowd at this new pizza joint intrigued me. I decided to skip the line and order online. Their online interface, by the way, actually works well! There are many take-out places around that have ordering apps or websites that make you believe they don't even want you ordering from them, so good on you Blaze for actually making it usable.  15 minutes after placing my order, I skip the massive line (love doing that anywhere I can!) and straight to the "Pick-Up" register. 2 employees we're working the register and 1 appeared to be cutting pizzas specifically for pick-up orders. After repeating my name 3 times, one to each employee who each sequentially looked at the next person like they didn't belong on that register, the guy cutting pizzas said he had my order and was cutting it.  I had 4 pizzas and he pointed to 2 boxes and said he was working on the other 2. Once my stack has accumulated to 4 I thought he would call me, after a minute or so I asked if they were ready. He said Yes, and nothing else. Grabbed my pizzas and walked out.  The whole "customer-interaction" part of the restaurant... it needs some fine-tuning here. I think if I hadn't said anything to anyone they wouldn't have batted an eye and I might still be there waiting on those pizzas! I'll dine in next time and see if things change. Who knows, it might have been a rough night?  So on to the pizzas. Their ingredient list is extensive, I bet you could make trillions of different combinations. The pizzas are 11", a little bit bigger than your average "personal" pan, and hover around the $6-7 price range. They're going to make a killing off the college kids looking for value.  When comparing them to other budget pizza offerings around, it was outstanding! Great red sauce with that had nice spicy tang at the end. Meats (I got the meatball, salami, and pepperoni on mine) were all individually distinguishable and flavorful. Cheese was generous on my pie and great as well.  If the service is better next time, I'll be the best long-term customer they have. This is now likely the closest pizza place to the house, and while I like it, I want to LOVE it! Update Pending!

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. $4 for a salad smaller than my balled fist? I think not...
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

oqpE-hlhz4uutPBxvUBMFQ.text: So, I've heard raves from Blaze and was excited to finally try to get a vegan pizza. Our pizza was supposed to be done at 10:20pm. I understand it was pizza and they were working hard. By 10:35, I got my pizzas and sides. While there, one of my pizzas was incorrect although they were both done. Then I watched a worker go to clean and come back to the line without washing his hands. I let one of the other staff members know. Redeeming factors are that the staff members were friendly and the food delicious. I will be back to hopefully a better experience in organization.

UmmHJSTWUqMxAZxPG3JH2A.text: service was kinda slow because they were a tad busy.  pretty much my only complaint.  i like that they ditched the straws.  i'm not a "#save the turtles" kind of girl but i am appreciative.  i used a coupon from yelp and the guy was very polite.  it was for a free drink and he said he would just let me have it free and wouldn't even put it in.  i got a half pizza, but they didn't give me a half box.  i got kind of sad, as i wanted a half box and it would be easier for me but oh well. overall very good :)

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. drink with strawless lid
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. simple pizza, sauce + cheese

5FFk_pPKj8T3RWpOgPuc9g.text: UPDATE (As of 4/21)... it breaks my tummy's heart to have to remove a star from this location but they've officially deserved it.   I went to meet a friend for lunch over the weekend (around 2:15pm) and was halfway greeted by a young lady writing the orders down. I used to be in customer service so I understand the "I don't want to work today" mood and was ok to just ignore, as she wasn't rude... she just wasn't polite. The line started to pick up a little with a family in front of us that had a specific preference for how their sauce was put on their pizzas. I'm guessing that this young lady was annoyed by the fact that she had to pitch in to help move orders along. After saucing my friend's pizza, she started on mine. I ordered a half White Top and half Green Stripe... for the green stripe side, I asked if she could put the spicy sauce on there...She didn't acknowledge that she heard me but proceeded to complain to another young lady, preparing the dough, by stating "I hate when it gets busy, people get dumber..." the other young lady looked hesitantly at us and the other customers that had started forming a line and tried to remain optimistic. The complaining individual then abruptly pushed my pizza down the line, put the toppings she knew to go on each side (didn't ask me anything) and went back to take orders with a heavy sigh and a very obvious eye roll! No ma'am... that is completely unacceptable on any level. If you believe that people are "dumb" for having a preference for their pizzas, from a place that encourage customers to HAVE A PREFERENCE... then you should have opted to make the dough and not talk to people at all.   My friend and I enjoyed the weather so we decided to sit outside and chat a bit because it was getting loud inside with the lunch rush. As I was checking out I realized that a few of the people working in the oven area cared more about having a conversation then actually trying to get orders out. Again, I waved it off and enjoyed the outside weather and pizza. I ate the White Top side and noticed there were a few burned spots, but nothing that caused me any concern. I get the other half home to have later in the evening....but behold, it's burnt. So that's half of a pizza now in the trash because some individuals didn't want to take their weekend job seriously.   I love Blaze, so while I haven't counted them out completely... It will be a long while before I try this location again!

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. The burnt bottom half of my pizza

CzK4_qqObKkhB0cxaGVmTQ.text: My son could hardly wait to try this place and create his own pizza.  It was really crowded which gave us plenty of time to marinate over the toppings/sauce/crust.  He decided on a basic sausage, bacon pizza.  I had the pesto mixed with red sauce base with bacon, mushrooms, sausage and a pesto drizzle on top.  We both loved the thin crust and the pizza was flavorful and was pretty good overall.  I think this location is pretty new so it tends to be busy no matter the time, but the line moves along quickly.  The pizza is reasonably priced and they offer a few different types of salad as well and the drinks seemed to be really popular.

BKjdnUYMFPjZQHJs6WTZIQ.text: I have been here 3 times now. I just realized on my third visit they have vegan mozzarella. I did the build your own and made the best vegan pizza I have ever had. All of the omnivores in the group loved their pizzas too. I highly recommend this place it is very fast and delicious.

JWe-vFtjfCUVGQ7kfma5lw.text: This is my second experience at a pizza restaurant like Blaze with the whole "three minute pizza" shtick. My first experience was in DC and I loved it, but I gotta say, this was even better.   I was able to try a bunch of things my first time at Blaze! Going through the line to select your ingredients for your pizza, they've got everything laid out nice and neat and labeled so you're not holding up the line while you're going through. Big help!  I got a side Caesar and the meat lovers pizza with spinach. They have like four different types of salads and they actually all looked really good. The Caesar was delicious! The dressing was perfect and the lettuce was crisp AF. Don't sleep on the side Caesar.   The meat lovers pizza after coming out of the oven looked GREAT. Very pretty and taster just as good as it looked! The crust was crunchy on the outside and the meatball and pepperoni were spot on. You'd never know it was cooked in three minutes.  A couple other things to note: the service was top notch and the lemonades were DELICIOUS. Very happy people working as far as I could tell and there were four different lemonades - the blood orange was my favorite.   If you're looking for a quick pizza and want something a little different from traditional places, I'd say this is a great place to try!

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

CIEWp63aZRiOaCEwVvxbgw.text: Another crazy parking lot with minimal parking for numerous stores. I visited this location on a Friday around 1:15pm The inside and outside areas were very crowded.  So loud  inside with echos that I did not dine in, not how I wanted to spend my lunch hour. The employees were friendly and explained the concept of building the pizzas before I ordered. $8.50 I modified one of their original pizzas.  Many toppings to choose from.  Hot out the oven, ingredients fresh, crust a little too thin for my taste (you could fold the whole pizza over easily), little greasy. Requested water for my drink...here we go with the baby cups for water...geesh.  Just because I want water doesn't mean I will drink a toddler portion, I'm still an adult. Good enough to return but not my first choice.  Same price for more food at local pizza shop.

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Meat eater modified
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. To go

vCsu7VY2ZCmNA7gm-K7IYw.text: First time I've been to this location.  Pretty much the same as all the rest.  Great pizza, served quickly with whatever toppings you like.  This spot should do great being so close to university.  This little section of the shopping center should honestly have some bus parking.  So close to the interstate and so many choices right there.  Onto the food.  I've not been liking red sauces as of recent, something to do with the acidity.  So, pesto or white sauce was my way to go.  I love the roasted red peppers, the garlic, and the spinach, have gotten that on almost every pie I've ever tried from them.  Fresh arugula on the finish as well.  Always good, always tasty.  There was a table beside us with a crowd that wasn't really very pleasant to my crowd or some others, but they looked pretty serious about wanting to fight.  This has nothing to do with the business per say, but they might want to think about a security person after 8pm, especially on the Friday and Saturday night crowds.  JMHO.

r3t4ge6_DAsFxNDHPMF-jw.text: I think I have told people about this place at least 6 times since I attended the Yelp event on Tuesday. When I first heard 'build your own pizza' I couldn't contain my eye roll imagining it would be like a subway of pizza shops- generic and underwhelming, but Blaze is anything but generic.   I had the gluten free pizza crust which was actually tasty, not like the cardboard you get at some other pizza joints. The staff was super accommodating and even offered to change their gloves to avoid gluten contamination, wow that is what I call service. This place has several different sauce bases to choose from including a pesto and several marinaras. The toppings all looked amazingly fresh including an assortment of cheeses (goat, gorgonzola, mozzarella, and many more).   I had the pesto base with gorgonzola and goat cheese, spinach, artichoke hearts, mushrooms, grilled onions, roasted red peppers, and oregano. The pizza was divine in terms of the quality of toppings. I do wish the crust would have gotten a bit more well done - but maybe the gluten free crust doesn't crisp up as much as the regular crust.   Also, had the arugula side salad with berries and cheese. The salad was good, but the staff was a bit heavy handed on the balsamic reduction, so if you don't like super sweet salad as for the reduction on the side. Over all though I was impressed with this place and will definitely be back soon!   Pro-tip: if you come at sunset bring your sunglasses because you will be blinded by the sun as the place doesn't have any blinds to keep out the bright rays.

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

cuL8FEr63pfCn8ZkK7sfBQ.text: I ordered the Pick Two.. BBQ Pizza and Dough Knots. I had it delivered to me here at work, so when I didn't know how bad it was. My pizza was so burned on the bottom. Again I was at work, so I couldn't leave to go take it back. So I had to deal. After finishing one slice and on Dough Knot, I just couldn't take it. I've never eaten here before, so not sure of what to expect. But this was definitely not a great experience.  I tried calling the store on three occasions, and no answer. I underatand they may have been busy, but this was just a mess.

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

b_KecY4M4SJbKTs8Iif1_Q.text: I really enjoyed my visit tonight.  We were shown lots of hospitality and the location looked great.   I had the meat eater pizza. It comes with pepperoni, meatballs, red onions, mozzarella, and red sauce. It was delicious. I'm usually not a fan of a thin crust but this was good. It was crispy but not hard.   I tried the blood orange lemonade. It was nice and sweet. This will be my drink of choice when i return.  I will definitely add Blaze to my list of go to places in the university area.

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

_Pla6lhocOF2Q5ketASbdw.text: Blaze pizza has never disappointed me with build your own pizza.  This is the first time visiting this particular one and the staff was friendly and willing to help you with what you wanted.  This will always be my go-to pizza spot and has been for about 4 yrs now.  I have tried Mod and never again that was a mistake.  LOL    I had my brother and nephew with me and told them to trust me you can add what you want and it will be good tasting.  They were skeptical but I already knew they would be on it once they tried it and sure enough they were amazed.    I always suggest Blaze when people ask about a quick spot for pizza so there you go, Blaze, a couple more fans.    The place was neat and clean also.

R83ceZRmpGydCuVn_uTGng.text: This is a make your own pizza place.  They offer different crusts and numerous toppings. . I got the cauliflower crust with chicken, spinach, tomatoes and mozzarella. It was very tasty and reasonably priced.     The pizza was  cooked to perfection and tasted delicious . This is like a pizza restaurant that I got with my daughter in Hawaii

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

9t_6OAC9S2UcdU5kPjrBWA.text: Great concept and quality ingredients.  Tons of options.  Not sure the portions are consistent considering what I observed while there (significant difference in amounts of cheese per pie, we toppings were very light).   Unfortunately I could only eat half my pizza.  They offer sea salt and oregano seasoning, which I like both - but all I could taste was salt.   I'll be back and try other options and AVOID THE SALT.

6PKcF75ffssrWPuWUIGivA.text: I love the build you own pizza. This is my go-to spot for a quick, reliable, and fresh pizza. It's like the Subway of pizza places.. you get to choose your own toppings, sauces, and cheeses. I'm a huge fan of goat cheese, so I love ordering that in addition to mozzerella. Be prepared for a line, especially during lunch hours. This is a popular place. I'm always in and out in 30 min. or less.

UtW1YWT6haUzzLE1vL1igA.text: I looooooooooooove Blaze and the concept of getting whatever you want on your pizza for one price. As someone who tends to love non-traditional pizzas, I love that they have a variety of vegetable toppings that I would want on my pizza. Also, it's generally pretty quick.   I took a friend to this location because he had never been and I just ordered a brownie. He loved his pizza. While I love their pizzas, the brownies were nothing to write home about.   The reason why I didn't give it a five is that the cooking can be hit or miss. Occasionally, I've had to take it home and toss it in the oven to get it to my liking.

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Desserts
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Food score
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brownie

fsY_FFndW6p9HkDDiNQeyA.text: Wow! Just wow! Had a fantastic experience here!  The team here on Saturday night was all smiles and a well oiled machine.  $8.95 for an unlimited topping pizza is a great deal. We got three of them plus drinks. Hopness Monster on draught - plus used our Yelp check in offer for a fountain drink!  These pizzas cook fast and taste delicious. My latest discovery is salami and brussel sprouts (with spicy sauce) - surprisingly killer combo! The blood orange lemonade here is sooo good too.  So when my wife went to sit down outside and 1/2 her pizza slid onto her and the rest hit the floor. I told one of the young men working there. He hopped behind the counter and without hesitation fixed us another pizza. Way to go Jayden!! Now that's True customer service.  Way to go Blaze!!!

6OKzq6irSfiApTye_4ItTg.text: I am not much of a pizza fan but when I'm in the mood i do love blaze! You get a nice size pizza for a very reasonable price and their lemonade is so good! The line is very busy around lunch time but goes by fast. Highly recommend

qxpg01f33G7mYEY73M_AUQ.text: Can't beat a build-your-own pizza joint, as in the subway of pizza. There are so many options for toppings to appeal for a wide range of diets/preferences. I also really like that the prep area is all open to the point that I can watch them place my pizza in the oven and box it up. I feel so confident leaving here knowing that my food wasn't dropped on the floor (at least not after the heat had killed the germs)!   I have visited countless times and staff always seems laid-back and patient. One time my pizza was left in a tad too long and burned a little on one side. I was asked if I wanted it to be made again. They made a fresh one and offered the half burnt one to me as well (why let the unburnt side go to waste!) + a drink. As with most restaurants I go to I usually make my pizza in the same style, but I have no complaints so hey....

N2BHDL8LynsaX6di5BXwIg.text: Late post from Grand Opening Day - present time.  I dropped by because I saw a long line. Because I'm bossy especially when I see many people in line of a restaurant AND it's pizza - I'm going to ask questions.   Free Pie did you say? I'll wait.... in the line for 2hrs and 30min. for some darn good FRESH firefrilled pizza - for free! I am certainly overdressed, as I'd just left work and wore heels on this lucky day. But I stood anyway because I met some new friends while waiting. The owners also hung out and gave away free coupons for those who missed the closing hours. It was worth the wait.  I'd steer clear of the balsamic drizzle and always get the "blood orange lemonade."  Since it's opening I've been back several times and brought my family there too. This spot is pizza customization at its finest. My on,y issue was my pizza was not cooked well. Each visit, I let my pizza fire blaze for an extra minute or two.   The ratings alone are for my overall experience on most occasions; however, I had one terrible encounter which I'm hoping the person is no longer employed at this location until diversity training has been confirmed.   I was pregnant and craved Blaze. When we arrived I took a restroom break. Meanwhile, husband ordered our meal. While waiting, he stepped outside to take a smoke break - I know, I hate he smokes too, yet he does anyway. Digressing, the young lady notified him of an alleged smoking area; unfortunately, there was no signage or designated area.  Long story short, she insist on forcing him to leave and he then explained he's grabbing our food to go so the smoke break should be short, especially if she'd spent her energy completing our order vs spending time forcing an argument. (Couldn't disagree here.)  Mind you, I was in the restroom for roughly 15 minutes max. Fortunately, when I came out, food was ready to go and other employees apologized for her disruptive behavior. I didn't know why until my husband and I got in the car. I'm glad I missed the drama because preggo and hungry don't mix well.   Fast forward, the customer service has not been as bad as the previous encounter, but it certainly isn't nearly as good as the first few days. Management should consider revisiting customer service focused discussions. Poor service engagement and lack of concern for quality pizza is starting to spill into ratings.

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Create your own pizza

mTcDaLNDJJH7JPx8084vcA.text: Took my vegan daughter to the location closest to UNC Charlotte. She was able to build her own vegan pizza (unlimited toppings, one price) with vegan mozzarella and chorizo. I enjoyed my pizza, which I was able to modify any way I wanted. I had a half pizza and salad combo. I love the concept (think of a Subway ordering process) and at this location, the execution was great! There were interesting sodas and juice choices, too.  Crust and sauce and toppings are solid, not quite 5 star pizza, but we will return!

jfYME9oZ1ynj1Yq7YZY1lA.text: I can officially say that as of today I have been to blaze Pizza twice!   My first and absolutely last time!   I called their number to place an order at the University location and they direct me to their website. I go to their website to place the order, get all the way through to adding to my cart and it says the store is too busy to take the order. I change to their Concord location a few miles away the order processes fine. I get a call when halfway to the Concord store saying they don't have the keto crust but it is in the University location. I decide to drive to the university location to place the order in person and Wouldn't you know when I get to that store University they are out of that crust.  A waste of time and gas!  I hate wasting my money when trying to spend my money.  If I could rate lower I would!

tIs7pP34juj_UXLuH7QDfQ.text: I love the fact that this establishment gives plenty of vegan options. A very vegan friendly environment. I entered the restaurant to grab a pizza about an hour before close. There was a gentlemen doing side work as I entered. He greeted me and asked me to give him just a moment and he would be with me. Upon finishing his duties he came up to me and asked what I would like to order. I politely asked him if he could wash his hands as he just finished cleaning and I don't want him touching my food. He quickly washed his hands and put on gloves. The only con I have is that I have to constantly mention basic cleanliness procedures to these workers. I do understand they're young, but they need to have more intensive training on the health hazards and precautions when handling food. The young man prepared me a fresh piece of crust and proceeded to make my pizza. He was very polite. I wish I knew his name. The gentleman that work at this location always have a great attitude. The females, outside of one black female, always have very snooty attitudes. I'm not sure why, but they are very rude almost as though they are doing us a favor by preparing our pizza. Thank you for being vegan inclusive.

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Build Your Own Spicy Marinara , Vegan Cheez, Vegan Spicy Chorizo , Mushrooms , Spinach, garlic , red onion

SK_lVy_uH0OintBHQ0d6Sg.text: I have been to Blaze many times and it's always a great experience. It's kind of like a subway of pizza. You walk thru and tell them what you want on your pizza and they make it in front of you.  The pizza is consistently great and one is more than enough for one person. I'm able to share with my 4 yo and still feel full.  The blood orange lemonade is sooo good as well. It's s must for me every time I go. My meal is usually about $12.

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Build your own!

Pqy4VgNqMNSbLLv4SjFu_g.text: I love Blaze because I can satisfy my pizza cravings with vegan cheese and fresh toppings. I go here often and Delano always provides excellent service and he's honestly the best at the oven (I've had someone else burn my pizza twice!)

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pizza pizza

QWAG6mMpCQ5k1nRBvsuiag.text: I love that fact that you can get a lot of toppings on your pizza, but I feel as if the pizzas aren't cooked long enough. I get the "fast fired" mindset, but my pizza was very "slimy" and the toppings would just slide off of the pizza. The pizza was good but very messy.   Update: 7/13/2018  I went back and got another pizza. Total 180 from my last experience! The pizza was not slimy or sloppy. It was great. I added the seasonal broccoli as a topping and it was great. But those garlic knots-- definitely a great add on to the menu! I was thinking they should just have a garlic knot pizza LOL!

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

O5OJC-vOFea85XcbYLgvaA.text: First time here.  Like the idea of build your own. Enjoyed food. Quick and friendly service.

2gFv68KDL-lt7HP1MNMYMw.text: Blaze is a super casual, make your own pizza place. The pizzas came out fairly quickly, and it was relatively cheap too.  Efficient assembly line.  Have been looking forward to this place finally opening since hearing about it. The area has several other pizza options in proximity however this is the a much different concept than traditional pizza. The Build your own $7.95 option allows to use unlimited toppings. You also have the option of the standard thin, a rising crust or gluten free.   Two things I would do differently: Avoid the balsamic drizzle as it was quite strong and took over the flavor of some of the pizza.  Get a drink. I opted for water but saw several delicious looking lemonade and juice options.

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

j08GkHXpAPd8c7C7t60zNQ.text: I received a gift card to this place about a year ago. I'm never really in the area so I haven't had a chance to use it yet. Today was the day. My husband and I were trying to find something to do on this beautiful Saturday. I was digging through my gift card stash and thought "why not?!?". We live about an hour away. This place was so worth it. They were not busy when we came in, so we didn't feel rushed. The staff was super kind and helpful. My husband ordered the "green stripe" pizza and I decided to "build my own". We LOVED our pizzas. I'm so glad we had the opportunity to drive out here just to visit this establishment. Would definitely recommend to others. Way to go you guys!

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

AIxwS_Fw2gA5uN2BTCYDrw.text: Always a huge fan of Blaze Pizza! I got there at 12:30 PM it was crazy packed, but the service was fast and friendly. I love that they offer turkey sausage as a topping!   I checked in at this location and they had an offer for a free fountain drink!

tw-n7knHEdWr2aj-ZGFNLQ.text: Came in here and had two pizzas. Both were good. The staff need a little bit more hospitality and training. The Caesar salad was a bit disappointing. I wasn't a big fan of the quality of dressing. Overall a good experience but not somewhere I would frequent too often.

photos.caption: Photo of Blaze Fast-Fire'd Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Caesar salad

Sr9j05wkJ52ESRNLD3AQdw.text: Unique concept.  Good pizza. Loudest restaurant I've ever eaten in. It's all concrete and glass no sound absorption.  You can't have a conversation or hear the staff to place an order.  No liquor license yet but a bottle or draft beer is listed at $5!!!  It's kinda like a Moes but for pizza.

XRJzhTxrgvKI-j3JRPE-JA.text: Drove 40 minuetes (on a monday at prime dinner time) to eat at this establishment only to find it closed for a yelp event. Will not make this mistake again. Thanks yelp...

fRohYJGSV6pfxUQoCitKJw.text: Well, I just can't get enough of Blaze and I am so thrilled they have come to the University area! We were desperately lacking fast casual restaurants and Blaze definitely delivers in that category. If you have never been to a Blaze, it is a Subway style restaurant. You choose your dough, sauce, cheese, meat, toppings, and seasoning to make your own Pizza. Now, they have some standard pizzas you can order that are pretty great but nothing is better than making your very own artistic creation of ooey-gooey goodness. The great thing about Blaze is that all their ingredients are fresh, locally sourced when possible, and free of preservatives. Also, they have phenomenal salads with seasonal and fresh ingredients! They offer desserts like brownies and s'more cookies. All fast fired in 90 seconds in their pizza oven, which you get to see! Try their homemade aqua frescas, they are so refreshing! This location also offers LOCAL brews on tap! Who doesn't love beer with their pizza?! Also, I love that the staff here are so pleasant, generous, and kind. Check this out, if you haven't, you will not be disappointed.

fANSMmd4-EdqzZ0Aetf4SA.text: This is a great place to go for a pizza with vegan cheese. It's fast and honestly very good. We are there every Sunday!

WOxWNpNnx9iXyzinDojF4w.text: Always a treat when eating here the concept is great and the staff is always friendly and helpful. We frequently eat there for lunch

1R5qdXadS5tEV6ZXl-ROSQ.text: I LOVE being able to customize my own pizza. The ingredients are different, delicious, and fresh. Wish there were more meat options and that they told you about the free "finishers" that can be put on after it comes out of the oven. But I went over there with my last two slices and the guy hooked me up with some fresh arugula on top!! Even if you're getting red sauce try pesto on the crust... you won't be disappointed.

mFq5-dqtPQLQvM-Zty8SPQ.text: Very first Blaze Pizza experience.  AWESOME and DELICIOUS!  Can't wait to go back.  Salads look amazing, saw them after ordered pizza.  Excited they are in our neighborhood!  Manager super nice too!

GlEcm_l0iocarwqCM0K2Zg.text: This place is extremely vegan friendly. All the crusts are vegan and the vegan cheese is great. They actually take cross contamination seriously and will do a glove change before handling your food if you specify that you're vegan. Plus, some places will offer vegan crust, sauce, and cheese and then skimp on the toppings but not here. They had literally every vegetable i could imagine putting on a pizza. Adding balsamic after baking makes it even better.

tsiLNAp20TwXFu60Liosqg.text: If u are looking for a great pizza place with fresh ingredients, great hospitality, very positive atmosphere, then this is the place for you.  I had the meateaters pizza that's comes with pepperoni and meatballs but I substituted for bacon, sausage and pepperoni with roasted garlic, and it was delicious.  Depending on bomber of customers, the pizza prep may take a little time but cooks very fast, less than 3mins.  Also try the blood orange lemonade was really good, I would recommend this restaurant to anyone.

lX9ClXYbzbGXBooaeTta8Q.text: Great pizza. Great dough knots. I recommend the blood orange lemonade. You have to tell them not to burn your food. Although that's kind of the point with the wood fire I was seeing people with food so black you couldn't tell what it was. When I asked they did it right. I accidentally dropped my pizza and immediately they called out remake and gave me a new one although I did not ask and was willing to pay again. I will definitely be going back.

IjCy6Ck7v4p0Sn_fcKz_AA.text: The pizza is great but the customer service is terrible. I came in around 4pm and the girl who took my order was hunched over the counter, didn't greet me, barely looked up at me, and seemed generally annoyed. The next girl in the line who put the toppings on my pizza was helpful and made a comment to that girl about needing to smile. After I checked out, a different girl cut my pizza. When I asked to add drizzle, she rolled her eyes at me, added the drizzle, and then shoved my pizza into a box without saying a word. I could hear an employee ask what everyone's problem was to which another employee said "don't nobody want to be here". Well, that was pretty evident. The whole ordering experience was awkward and incredibly off putting. I'll buy an $8 pizza somewhere else where I won't have to inconvenience workers who clearly don't want to be there. I understand that this location employees a lot of college students due to its location but there must be better motivated and polite students to hire.

5J8AmwiEvPmK1r6nNA-rLw.text: Pretty good pizza, salad was great. Ask for a receipt IF you need one because they wont email it to you later!  #expensereportproblems

XKBx3dzI_R0JwWG_50tKrw.text: Good pizza but the online ordering system is poorly organized and the staff has a bit of an attitude. The online system gives the option to wait until you arrive to bake the pizza, but 80% of the time the cooks bake it anyway and it's there, getting cold when you arrive. The staff is unfriendly and not helpful. When they don't bake my order prematurely, I get blown off when I check in to pick it up. At least twice when I've been rudely encouraged to wait for my name to be called, they had misplaced the order, causing me to wait over 30 minutes before anyone realized what happened. I also had a cook argue with me when I asked to have my pizza remade and corrected.

yPlOoHjsYSvFSxHMApMtag.text: Great service. Great food! This place is great if you want pizza quick with great flavor. The pies are big enough for you to finish without feeling like a pig. The "Build Your Own" bar works perfectly for the amount t of people coming in the door. The service was wonderful. I'll definitely be a repeat customer.

OAmj3uECnMsKf5n11dLOSg.text: This is my favorite build your own pizza spot in Charlotte. The build your own is my favorite, you can pick unlimited toppings for your pizza as well as the type of sauce you would like. And I always get my pizza well done. It never fails to satisfy my pizza craving.

IuFh0UrY0GfPqc3fhlNAGA.text: This pizzeria is ok nothing I'd go out of my way to try again. I like the pizza oven idea as it reminded me of Italy but the toppings are mediocre.

syEzHC8d2GDe-VY1RE9pOw.text: I've had blaze before but now that I do not eat dairy cheese, I frequent it even more. I love that they are one of few pizza joints that offer vegan cheese and ingredients. There are a ton of ways to personalize your pizza and so far the staff has been outstanding. Even after visiting once, the young lady at the register who's name I am forgetting, recognized me the next time and called me by name. My wife and I partake in a blaze pizza at least once per week and ordering online to pickup and skip the line is the best thing since sliced bread.

_53be3dvLQLAaRti9so50w.text: Did an online order and it was ready in time, exactly what I ordered, and so delicious. I didn't think the trifecta could exist in Charlotte. Just ate my leftovers for breakfast because I was already craving it again!!

Ke3Iz8wV9o7JYEJ22SqOxQ.text: First time there, I got the high rise crust which meant for two dollars extra I got my pizza and seemingly another small Crust under it which separated so imagine that crust sliced in half like layers of cake. They were about to close so I said nothing and trashed the majority of it.

HMZE9UObd0Dq51glsAyE7w.text: Blaze Pizza is very tasty and fast. The quailty of the food was great and staff was nice. They made sure my first time they explained how the process worked. The different flavored lemonades where excellent. I like that  they have gluten free options. The line waa long but it moved very quick. Their concept of " fast food" pizza works well for them and they make it look simple.

PVuLY_xmw8EeZdXVx7ArUw.text: I was in the area and decided to give Blaze Pizza a try.  The concept remind me of &pizza in DC (which is delicious). I decided to Build My Own Pizza. The servers were very stingy with the toppings. I had to ask for more topping on everything on my pizza. The server said that customers are always asking for more. As for the pizza, it was ready in less than 5 minutes. However, it was ok. Nothing special. It's not something that I will be telling all my friends about.

z3Eb89-Bwzb33M8n67p5Dg.text: If this pizza restaurant doesn't deserve 5 stars, I am not sure which does.  I debated about 4 or 5 stars and I am not easily pleased.  We have gone 3 times now and laugh about having to pace ourselves so we don't get burned out but this food is addictive!!!!  They are almost always busy, but are VERY efficient at getting you in and eating!  I love being able to have my pizza made EXACTLY as I want it.  Choose the toppings, and how much of each, walk down the line and watch your pizza cook in just 3 minutes.  Amazing and delicious!!!!   The staff, for the most part, appear to be college students and have a great attitude.  You are treated like old friends and the smiles and jokes go a long way toward making you want to go back again and again.  We are hooked!!!
